name: The Leopard & the Lotus: Rogue5 / Cleric26 / Monk9
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
A quiet warrior prophet who aims for balance between the mind and the body….
 

Title: The Leopard and the Lotus
  • AKA: The Hallowed Mystic of the Hin
  • Classes: Rogue5 / Cleric26 / Monk9
  • Race: Halfling
  • Alignment: Any Lawful (Lawful Neutral being ideal)
  • XP Penalty: 20% beyond 7th level
  • Playable: 1-40 PvM
 
Attributes
Str: 10
Int: 14
Wis: 16 (24)
Dex: 16 (24)
Con: 12
Chr: 8
 
Domains: Travel & Trickery

Level Guide
1 Rogue 1, Blindfighting
2 Cleric 1
3 Cleric 2, Extend Spell
4 Cleric 3, Wis17
5 Cleric 4
6 Cleric 5, Finesse
7 Monk 1, Evasion
8 Cleric 6, Wis18
9 Cleric 7, Craft Wand
10 Cleric 8
11 Cleric 9
12 Rogue 2, WF: Kama, Wis19
13 Cleric 10
14 Cleric 11
15 Cleric 12, Silent Spell
16 Monk 2, Wis20
17 Monk 3
18 Rogue 3, Expertise
19 Monk 4
20 Rogue 4, Dex17
21 Cleric 13, EWF: Kama
22 Monk 5
23 Cleric 14
24 Cleric 15, Epic Prowess, Dex18
25 Cleric 16
26 Cleric 17
27 Monk 6, Great Dex I, Improved Knockdown
28 Cleric 18, Dex20
29 Cleric 19
30 Cleric 20, Great Dex II
31 Rogue 5
32 Monk 7, Dex22
33 Cleric 21, Great Wis I
34 Cleric 22, Great Wis II
35 Cleric 23
36 Cleric 24, Great Dex III, Dex24
37 Monk 8
38 Cleric 25
39 Monk 9, Great Wis III, Improved Evasion
40 Cleric 26, Armor Skin, Wis24
 
Combat Vitals
  • Base Melee AB: 37
  • Base Ranged AB: 35
  • Naked AC: 36
  • HP: 350
  • Buffed AC, +5 items: 76
  • Buffed Melee AB: 63/60/57/54/51/63/58*
  • *with a successful Word of Faith, you can actually increase your AB by 2 more that does not count toward the +20 cap, so your schedule could be 65/62/59/56/53/65/60
 
Skill Points: 238
  • Concentration: 43 (44)
  • Craft Weapon: 5 (7)
  • Disable Trap: 10 (17)
  • Heal: 5 (12)
  • Listen: 10 (19)
  • Open Lock: 5
  • Search: 10 (12)
  • Set Trap: 10
  • Spellcraft: 43 (45)
  • Spot: 20 (27)
  • Tumble: 40
  • UMD: 30
  • Remaining: 7
 
Saving Throws   (vs Spells)
Will:   31                   (40)
Fort:  25                  (34)
Reflex: 30               (39)
 
Max Spell Slots with +12 to Wisdom / Preferred Spells
1st: 10, Bless, Protection from Evil, Entropic Shield, Shield of Faith, and fill the rest with Divine Favor
2nd: 9, Aid, Bulls Strength, Endurance, Owl’s Wisdom, and fill the rest with Extended Divine Favor
3rd: 9, Negative Energy Prot, Prot from Elements, Darkfire, Freedom, Magic Vestmesnt, the rest Prayers
4th: 9, GMW, Death Ward, the rest Divine Powers
5th: 9, Improved Invis, True Seeing, Spell Resistance, 3 Hastes, 3 Battletides
6th: 7, 3 Extended Hastes, 4 Harms
7th: 7, 3 Words of Faith, 4 Silent Harms
8th: 7, 3 Aura vs. Alignment, 4 Extended Regenerate
9th: 7 3 Summon Monster IX, 4 Implosions (or Extended Aura vs Alignment)
 
Strengths
  • Undispellable Cleric Madness
  • Can cast up to 11 Harms
  • Very Strong AC which provides an innate resistance to crits
  • Strong AB when buffed, can hit with frequency creatures with 70ish ACs
  • Strong Saves
  • Great Skill Set and UMD
  • Can Craft Wands of Improved Invis, Haste, Invis, etc.
  • Wide variety of combat options: melee, ranged or spell
  • Good damage output
  • Monk Speed (30%)
  • Multiple combat Feats: IKD, Expertise, Flurry of Blows
  • 9 Reasonable Stunning Fists / DC: 37 (43 max)
 
Weaknesses
  • 20% xp penalty
  • Moderate Hit Points
  • Pure and Near Pure Wizard/Sorcerers
  • No Discipline (note, one may siphon skill points from Listen and Spot to maximize Discipline, this is a player/environment call, but note that the high AC this build offers gives you an innate resistance to KD/IKD, Called Shot.  Improved Disarm from a large weapon could be an issue, but at best would give your opponent a +4 bonus that you could negate by turning on Expertise)
 
Playstyle
Longterm buffs for your day travels.  Short term buffs for your big fights and boss fights.  Launch a Word of Faith to blind your opponents (no save) and then tear into them with your rapid attack schedule with an even further +2 AB because your opponent is blinded.  For those big foes with low or no spell resistance, drop some Harms and Silent Harms.  Use Craft Wand to keep a nice supply of Improved Invis, Invis and back-up Hastes.  Summon Monster Wands are also useful as these can soak up IGMS from enemy casters as well as Bigbys and Ruins.  Turn on Extended Regenerate to insure your hit points never get too low.  Against your weak-Fortitude foes, you can even get away with an Implosion.  You have UMD to use Arcane scrolls, wands and other devices, and your Divine Trickery power will grant up to +14 to your Search, Open Lock and Disable Trap skills (and your Stealth skills in general).  For items, gravitate toward items which increase your Dex and Wis.  Find the harmony and balance both these attributes bring.  After that, Strength is next and then Constitution.  Amulet of Protections for Natural AC, and Sun Soul boots, or any boots that grant Dodge AC. 
 
Builder’s Commentary
He doesn’t win any AB or AC contests.  He doesn’t win any spell power contests.  He doesn’t get Epic Dodge or deal tons of sneak damage.  He doesn’t win any over-the-top hit points or specialize in any one thing.  He just wins.  On the surface he doesn’t look like much, but once you look under the hood you realize the little guy has quite a motor.  In most Cleric Rogue Monk builds, the usual path is to achieve Epic Dodge, or maximum attack schedule, or HiPS, or the obligatory Cleric 38/Monk1/Rogue1 Imploder.  This peaceful warrior does none of these things, but instead achieves balance in everything.  He is equally at home in melee or ranged combat.  He can enhance and augment his casting ability with Wands, Silence and Extend Spell.  He can deal with traps, locks, detect the unseen, move fast with Extended Hastes (52 rounds) and 30% Monk speed increase, UMD all scrolls and other devices.  He can stand in the midst of a fray bolstered by high AC and 50% concealment and still relax knowing that his saves are strong.  His buffs cannot be dispelled unless stripped by Breaches or Disjunctions.
 
One of the things I found interesting is that this may be the first time I took a character’s dexterity to 24 but then stopped short and didn’t reach for Epic Dodge.  Those builds have been done before, and they typically look something like a Cleric20/Monk9/Rogue11.  In exchange for the signature Dex calling card, I instead chose undispellable buffs, longer spell durations, 2 cleric bonus feats, and earlier maturation of the Cleric spell progression, and a higher Wisdom for more spell slots and higher AC.  There’s nothing I hate more than playing a build that doesn’t mature until Level 38-40.
 
Additionally, Rogue was taken mostly pre-epic to front load Trap and UMD skills.  Rogue was not taken for Stealth skills at all.  This is not a stealther (but with Trickery domain he can still do that unlimited if he so chooses).
 
This build does reach some lofty ACs without stretching too hard.  In playtesting through the PGCC, some of the higher AB folks were able to hit him from time to time 9(rarely), they were never able to threaten a critical.  Something to consider.

posts.author: jassamisalami
posts.content: Hey Grizz, I started playing this on WOG and it’s great. Craft wand with a cleric feels like cheating. But I’m curious about the attack schedule you listed. It has 7 attacks which is your standard 4 +1(flurry)+1(haste)+1(?) where is the last attack coming from? Just curious. Awesome build, thanks!

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
jassamisalami wrote: ↑
May 21, 2023
Hey Grizz, I started playing this on WOG and it’s great. Craft wand with a cleric feels like cheating. But I’m curious about the attack schedule you listed. It has 7 attacks which is your standard 4 +1(flurry)+1(haste)+1(?) where is the last attack coming from? Just curious. Awesome build, thanks!
Standard monk attack progression?

posts.author: jassamisalami
posts.content: Ohh, interesting. I assumed you needed more levels in monk to get those extra attacks. I didn’t realize that only one level of monk would shift you into that bracket. Sorry, I rarely understand what is going on under the hood in these builds. Thanks for the help.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
jassamisalami wrote: ↑
May 21, 2023
Ohh, interesting. I assumed you needed more levels in monk to get those extra attacks. I didn’t realize that only one level of monk would shift you into that bracket. Sorry, I rarely understand what is going on under the hood in these builds. Thanks for the help.
It only does when using a Monk type weapon ala Kama...iirc - it's called "UBAB" (Unarmed Base Attack Bonus)
Specialty weapon: The monk retains his unarmed base attack bonus when fighting with a kama. Kamas are also permitted when using (the monk-specific feat) flurry of blows. (These are the only two instances in which kamas receive special treatment in the hands of monks, though.)
Note that this has been "opened" in NWN:EE so that any weapon can be added as a Monk type weapon to the UBAB type.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
May 21, 2023
Note that this has been "opened" in NWN:EE so that any weapon can be added as a Monk type weapon to the UBAB type.
Seriously? I know WoG widened it to include some additional "monky" weapons, but EE really allows for all weapons to attract UBAB? I'm guessing a lot of this will be regulated on the PW/Module side, rather than the player side, lest mayhem ensue.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
As long as the weapon in question is declared as a Monk type weapon, well...yeah.  I don't know about weight/size stuff, though.  But as it is now "open", probably everything is defineable in the 2das.  It's not something that one can change with the GUI or Settings - one has to edit the 2da(s) in question.

Since anyone can open a Mod, and edit it, one could make the changes for one's SP game.  Not so for online play, however.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Unfortunately Grizz, this build must have gone under my radar when it was posted.
The more I look at it, the better I like it. And it is as you say; he doesn't win a min/max contest, but he still wins.
Probably better in a PW than a SP mod with the xp penalty.
All in all, a fine use of the 3 classes.
